item.title: Python_Regex
item.description: Some Advanced usage on regex get float number: import re target = 'total growth is : 8%-8.5%' rate = re.findall('(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', target) print(rate) ['8', '8.5'] #\d is any int, + is one to many #(?:...) #A non-capturing group allows you to apply quantifiers to part of your regex but does not capture/assign an ID. #so it means: find int or, if int follows a "." and any int afterwards, combine the int with ".
